name: ‎W5Go Books and Reading
description: This W5Go Lesson is on Books and Reading.   Reading builds the foundation for a child’s success in school and later on as an adult, it nourishes imagination and provides essential lifelong skills. By reading girls and boys can begin to learn what we don’t know about our world.   W5Go – Lesson on Books and Reading provides an excellent platform to engage your child, and help them get accustomed to the fun in reading. Multiple interactive features make this app a great learning tool to play again and again. Explore the VR Library to find the magic book, and go to the Secret Reading Room to find out what kind of different books there are. Find out when reading is useful in our lives by watching the animations, and playing the games. Learn new English words, rhymes, and phrases while you play.   Audio voice overs make this app entertaining for kids who are learning to read themselves, and for those who haven’t learned to read yet.   Engaging gameplay through puzzles, rhymes, stories, games and AR/VR interactive scenes. Children learn English words, letters, expand their vocabulary and knowledge.   Learn the value of Books and Reading, and enjoy a fun family bonding activity together by playing through the app with your child, or let them learn independently with the support of W5Go.     Ads Free Apps / No Internet or WiFi Needed:   Our Apps are designed by keeping the Children and their Parents in mind, thus the Apps are Ads Free. You won’t need any Internet/WiFi access after downloading and installing our apps, and this makes them playable almost anywhere.   About W5Go: W5Go is designed to raise the digital consciousness of the populace starting with the very young. It introduces the child to Digital Techniques and Technology in beautiful computer Graphics, Animations and Augmented Reality in a fun and entertaining way. It is also a good interactive way for the child to learn English words and expressions while playing the W5Go apps and games. The W5Go Apps and Games are the teacher, the Child simply learns by osmosis   Contact Us:   If you want to help us bring more in fun and interactivity into our app, please write to us with your ideas or suggestions at info@w5go.com.   Visit our Website at www.w5go.com.   Read our Latest Blog at https://w5go.wordpress.com.   Follow us on Social Media:   FACEBOOK @W5GoForChildren   Twitter @go_w5   Instagram @w5_go

name: ‎Wanderlust: Travel Stories
description: REVIEWS GameReactor - 9/10 The Sixth Axis - 8/10		 Adventure Gamers - 4/5 GRYOnline - 8.5/10 AWARDS Best Game Narrative - Baltic Sea Awards 2019 Best Mobile Game - Digital Dragons Indie Showcase Award 2019 Community Vote - Digital Dragons Indie Showcase Award 2019 IndieCade Paris Nominee Compatibility: This game is not compatible with iPad Mini 2, iPad Mini 3 and iPad Air 1. AN ANTHOLOGY OF TRAVEL STORIES In a bar, on the world's most remote island, a group of strangers share their stories. Experience travel through the eyes of these distinct individuals, including an idealistic student, a jaded reporter, or a man who’s simply a terrible planner. The course of each journey depends on your choices. AUTHENTIC, GROUNDED AND WELL-RESEARCHED Dive into playable novels inspired by true events and real places, written by passionate travelers and experienced reporters. See the world they saw throughout their journeys. VISIT REAL PLACES The lonely island of Rapa Nui Bustling streets of Bangkok Pristine expanses of the Antarctic Grasslands of the Serengeti 21 countries in total EMOTIONS COLOR PERCEPTION Your choices shape the characters’ mood, changing the way you see the world. All emotions are valid: happiness or enthusiasm aren’t everything, feeling sad or fatigued is perfectly natural. TAKE YOUR TIME Like a peaceful afternoon with a cup of tea and a novel, it’s a slow-paced and meditative experience. You don’t have to rush or fight, you can take in every moment at your own pace.  Give yourself space to think and feel. Get a glimpse of life in distant places. Take a fresh look at your notions about the world. START THE JOURNEY NOW.
keywords: Wanderlust: Travel Stories, Walkabout Games, Games, Travel, Adventure, Simulation, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎Walkr - A Gamified Fitness App
description: *** Winner of App Store's Best Game Award*** - Walkr combines your phone’s pedometer with a fun galaxy adventure game! - Up to 100+ fascinating planets and 30+ mission goals that motivates you to walk more - Thanks to the support of our over 3,000,000+ iOS players in Walkr! Walkr is the second offering in a series of health-conscious games from Fourdesire, creators of the Plant Nanny app with more than 10 million players! Hop on the Walkr spaceship and begin your adventure across the boundless cosmos! = KEEP UP GOOD WALKING HABITS = - With Walkr in your pocket, your daily steps are automatically recorded and converted into energy fuel for your spaceship - Tracks and records the amount of calories you burn and recommends daily fitness goals - Start up the booster when you begin walking to accumulate even more energy fuel = EXPLORE THE BOUNDLESS UNIVERSE = - Encourages you to stay active with up to 100+ fascinating planets and 30+ mission goals - Build your own collection of unique planets, spacefoods, and rare elements in the ever-expanding universe - Undertake missions to help adorable creatures from across the galaxy find their way back home = GET SOCIAL = - Invite friends to become your co-pilot and receive extra energy fuel - Join a fleet, and start your adventure with other captains for even more rewards - Visit the Planet Lab with friends to share energy fuel and unlock amazing planet wonders - Compete with friends from Comet to Galaxy League and grow together ＊Walkr uses the iPhone’s m7/m8 to record your movements accurately with minimal battery consumption.  ＊Walkr uses a design that consumes the least amount of power. If you use a mobile phone below iPhone 5, running GPS in the background can record your walking more accurately. However, it may still reduce the battery life. You can go to "Settings"> "Walkr" on your phone to stop the "Location" function of Walkr. Any problems or suggestions? We would love to hear from you!  Find us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/walkrgame Or visit us: http://walkrgame.com/en -- Super Pilot is a monthly subscription service that allows you to get an extra co-pilot position with 80% conversion rate.  US$1.99 will be charged on your iTunes Account after confirmation and when the subscription renews monthly.  The subscription will renew automatically each month. Account will be charged US$1.99 for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period. Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user’s Account Settings after purchase. Any unused portion of the free trial period will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription. -- Privacy Policy and Term of Service: http://walkrgame.com/terms
reviews: I have been playing Walkr for the last two years.  As other reviewers have noted, there is something about this game that keeps me coming back every day. I don't play many games on my phone and when I do I get bored after a few days. But Walkr is different.  It uses your phone's built in step tracker and adds energy to your pool to use in the game.  This energy is a sort of currency, so you're rewarded for being more active.  Such a simple idea but I can't think of another app like it. I love this app and will continue to play as long as I can. That being said I do feel it necessary to call for more updates from the developer--specifically more updates that add planets.  I know there are many loyal users who are stuck and out of things to do in the app besides the daily chores. I truly enjoy this app and hope it gets the attention it deserves.While I have made purchases in the app I have not yet subscribed to the new monthly subscription service. I hope that the additional revenue can fund the much needed development required to keep older users engaged.edited for spelling. I’ve used Walkr for a few years now. Something about the app still keeps me checking it every single day. They’ve made it so that feeling of accomplishment when I hit 10k steps never gets old. They’ve also continually added updates—the pedometer function works great, every now and then we’ll get new adorable planets, and they’ve added interesting activities like epics and labs. The little additions that make you feel heard and show you that they keep on trying :) I love the app and I really don’t have any complaints, BUT if I could request one thing, I would absolutely advocate for fitbit compatibility...! :D (Hi! I know you guys take our reviews pretty seriously! Pretty please??) This has seriously been the only reason I have not gotten a fitbit and for a half second even considered getting an Apple watch. I love the fitbit features more though and am really hoping fitbit compatibility will be incorporated soon! Until then, here’s to holding my phone while walking and running :) Please and thanks!! I love the concept of this game, however it’s very frustrating if you actually have a Fitbit and no way to sync it with the game. The phone’s pedometer is nowhere near as accurate, and not only that but I’m sure there are many people who don’t take their phones literally every time they walk around. Many times I leave my phone put away while I am up and about. My Fitbit stays on all day, logging several thousand more steps than my phone. Even when I take my phone with me on long walks it only logs about 75% of my steps compared to the Fitbit. So I miss out on all that energy I could be using in this game. I would also like to have more use for the energy I do earn. You can use it to boost production but not to upgrade or explore more planets. So it’s not as useful as it sounds. It would be more motivating if our steps directly helped discover and upgrade planets instead of having to use it to get coins faster to then purchase upgrades with, as you can generate coins without doing anything at all as long as you come back to collect them. That’s not as motivating as if you *had* to expend energy to discover new planets. Overall it’s a cute little game and a great concept but not as helpful/motivating as it could be.
keywords: Walkr - A Gamified Fitness App, Fourdesire, Games, Adventure, Health & Fitness, Simulation, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎Xibalba
description: Fight your way through the Mayan Underworld in this retro First Person Shooter. The path leads you through lush jungles, eerie catacombs and high tech bases filled with dangerous creatures, traps, vital powerups and weapons. The intuitive and precise controls provide an amazing gaming experience while the dark ambient soundtrack and high quality sound effects build a dense atmosphere. The game features 6 different levels, 3 weapons, 6 types of enemies and an epic boss battle. And if that isn't enough, you can test your skill with the even more challenging "hard mode". Headphones recommended!
reviews: I was looking for an FPS and I couldn’t find one that actually looked appealing. I saw this and I was like “Oh, it’s kind of like a new type of DOOM for mobile devices.” And so I bought it and played it and what do know it was the best thing ever! I completed the game in one day and the final boss fight was a very creative way of doing it like instead of just having to run around and shoot at the boss. It was just great. Despite the low content, I still like it better then other games. It’s also the most simple. In other FPS’s, there’s a shoot button a grenade button a switch weapons button a jump button and etc. But in this, there’s only like four buttons! Which is a good thing. But I think you should definitely make a second one that has an online multiplayer. If you can’t do that then you should make one called “Xibalba SURVIVAL” and with all the classic weapons from the first Xibalba and just a few new ones. In Xibalba SURVIVAL you have to survive onslaughts of enemies and for every wave you survive you get a few coins and the next wave gets harder. Every five or sixth wave there should be some type of mini boss. And the coins you can collect to buy upgrades for your guns in the shop. This would all be awesome if you could make it. Xibalba is a good game. I mean that with full objective sincerity. It is a good game. This game is fully fleshed out with enemies, weapons, levels, and boss fights and leaves the player thinking about the mysterious world Xibalba paints. This game shines like a beacon in the app store, as the developers didn’t settle for a cash-grab free game where they let you play a level for free and then immediately instate a paywall that’s 7.99 a week to play the rest of the game. This game knows what it is. It isn’t like the trash, ad-filled free games on the app store. You pay the money, you get the game. It’s that simple, no further micro transactions, you just play. And this is a solid title for a casual console game, let alone a mobile game. I can’t praise the developers of this game enough because they executed what they set out for with perfect ease and then they didn’t fall down the greedy pitfall of most app developers these days. Thank you, Xibalba. You give me hope for the future of mobile games. I’ve had this game for years and despite me having completed the pretty short campaign many times, I keep coming back to it... What little is there is basically perfect. I think the main thing is it feels exactly like what a mobile FPS should feel like. You can’t port COD or Overwatch-type games to mobile, I mean you can but who the hell is going to play a competitive shooter on their phone?! Xibalba tones it down to the point where it feels perfectly suited to the platform without it dumbing down the experience. This applies to all aspects of the game including its inherent pick-up-&-play-ness. I can just boot up the game and start playing within 3 seconds (because the game runs that smoothly), shoot a couple monsters, put it down and resume later. I honestly just wish there was more content. A Xibalba 2 with randomly generated levels or something...Anyways, one of my all time favorite mobile games.
keywords: Xibalba, PhobosLab, Games, Entertainment, Action, Adventure, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎Zombie Cats
description: Earth is under attack! Aliens are turning people into zombies and taking over the world. The only thing standing in their way is the Cat Lady and her clowder of misfit cats.  In this post apocalyptic zombie ridden world, cats with specialized abilities are the only weapon to fight the zombie hordes. The Cat Lady uses a make-shift catapult, crudely constructed from a rocking chair, a shovel and some duct tape to launch cats at zombies. The aliens do not use the zombies for all their dirty work, the Cat Lady must battle the aliens in their spaceships to preserve her way of life.  The cats can help her overpower the aliens and defeat the undead. Not all cats are created equal, some cats can ignite zombies on fire, some can bomb zombies, some can even build the Cat Lady a fence. Be careful, the desolated zombie filled badlands are full of obstacles, some can be helpful but some can be a hindrance!  Use trash cans, rigged cages, snares, and more to accomplish the simple task of survival. See how you rank with others using Game Center.  Accomplish tasks and get rewards to unlock and upgrade cats with special abilities.

name: ‎Z is for Zombie
description: While on an expedition to some recently discovered ruins near Machu Picchu in Peru, world renowned archaeologist Max Jones is bitten by an unknown insect. Hours later he dies. His interns transport Max’s body back to camp where an ambulance takes him to the morgue. Two miles from the hospital they are attacked. 48 Hours later all of South America is under martial law. The rest of the world turns attempts to turn a blind eye to the events happening in Peru, but as the infection spreads news reports begin to leak out. 72 Hours after Max dies, the infection is global. Hoping to stock up before it is too late, you decide to make a quick run to the mall to gather supplies. That was your first mistake **************************** Weapons **************************** You start with an unlimited supply of throwing stars. You can find a pistol, shortcut and occasional pipe bomb in the levels **************************** Two Exciting Modes of Play **************************** Story Mode - Play the game from start to Finish Survival Mode - How many zombies can you kill? ************* Instructions: ************* - Use the Joystick to move - Use the Shoot button to shoot your weapon - Don't get eaten
summary: Just a quick trip to the mall.

reviews: I love this mindlessly tapping game but when an add pops up every other round you can’t skip it until 10 seconds in and by that time because it doesn’t pause your game. The zombies are at your barriers attacking you already and you have to frantically kill them before they knock down the walls I have the same problem with the ads as some of the others. I play quite a variety of games and there are several that allow me to watch ads to  get crystals or something else and I will watch them. Because I can then use the crystals to speed things up or whatever. Yet this game has required ads that I am forced to watch and then you have ads that I can choose to watch and then you have banner ads. I saw where the complaint was made that the game didn’t pause when you were forced to watch an ad but there is no pause when you are trying to level up or do anything else. So my biggest problem is bad ad timing and no pause to level or even read to figure out what character you might want to level. I really tried to like the game I mean the concept is cool and the characters are really cool. I like tap games. Mindless repetitive fun. I’ve played a lot of them. This one has by far the most ads of them all. I get ads are how the game makes money outside of actual in game purchases. But come on. I haven’t gone a solid minute without an unskippable ad popping up. And to make matters worse after the ad I’m being forced to watch ends I’m stuck with zombies bashing in my barricades. How is it that the game doesn’t pause when an ad starts? And the no ad banner is just looming on the screen the whole time. 2.99 to stop ads. Nope. I’ll delete first.
keywords: Zap Zombies, Yojoy, Games, Adventure, Strategy, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎ZDAY Survival Simulator HD
description: This app has been optimized for iPad 3.  It is supported by iPad versions 1, 2 and 3.   If you have an iPhone or iPod touch, please download the Original ZDAY Survival Simulator. "For those of a certain age who loved adventure game books, it’s the perfect app to play and one that players will find themselves returning to. Not least because they’ll have to be pretty skilled to ‘win’!"  4 out of 5 stars - Jennifer Allen, 148 Apps.com "I've been having a blast with this since it's essentially gameifies what runs through my head whenever I read or watch a piece of zombie content, but it's also solid production-wise. I heartily recommend this to anyone that still has an itch for zombies, or even an appreciation of primarily text-based titles." ~ 4/5 stars - Brad Nicholson, Toucharcade "ZDAY is a 21st century text-based Simulator game that puts you the player in tough, real-world situations. The game play is easy and you can soon control it well." ~ 4/5 stars - Top10app.com "4/5 Stars" - Dan Zuccarelli, Gamezebo.com What better way to survive a full blown apocalypse than to PRACTICE? This is not a traditional shooter or an arcade style game where you poke buttons to shoot digital bullets at virtual zombies. ZDAY is a 21st century text-based Simulator that puts you the player in tough, real-world situations and says "what would YOU do?". Created and Designed by Animator and Director Ed Anderson, and beautifully illustrated by renowned DC comics artist Matt Haley, ZDAY is an intelligent adventure game that starts you in a crowded suburb at ground zero of a full blown infection, and says "what would you do?". Faced with one scenario after another, the player has to make choices that will either lead him to escape the zombie-filled suburbs or perish like so many others. The sophisticated game engine keeps track of every decision that you make, and keeps a running tab on your survival probability based on the choices you make.  So keep your wits about you, and choose carefully, because one wrong move could have you facing a zombie horde or roving bands of trigger-happy looters.  The detailed results given after the player has completed the challenge provides very useful insight to what he may have done right and wrong. If the player wants to try again he can, and since the game engine reshuffles many of the exact events, ZDAY Survival Simulator is never exactly the same twice.
reviews: The game is great but could use an update because almost scratch that all the events in the game are programmed with no diversity I was killing guards at a certain point with a samurai sword and it responded as if I was using a gun plus there is no simulation of what happened in the fight there is truly no reason to collect items since they do not help whatsoever this simulation is not an accurate way to see if you would survive a zombie apocalypse assuming there is one it has been nearly if not already a year since its last update which makes me think of this as another terraria I rate 2/5 since you can't rate 1.5/5 from the full reviews This is a great game for a car ride, or for a get together with a bunch of friends, especially kids (like pre-teens).  It's fun to have a narrator, and a player (or group of players acting as a team).  The "enthusiasm" of the narration will enhance the fun as the player(s)There are a few places where there are some typos, so it makes the game seem unpolished and "kiddie" at times.Adults will likely get bored with this game after the first day, but it is great for when you have a group of young teens and they can each try to best each other.There are also some generally good tips on survival theory, should an event in real life ever warrant such skills.It's fun... and it's only $2.
keywords: ZDAY Survival Simulator HD, Mongadillo Studios Inc., Games, Entertainment, Simulation, Adventure, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎Zenus VR
description: Published on VRFocus.com and various VR news outlets http://www.vrfocus.com/2016/05/survive-alien-attacks-in-zenus-vr-now-launched-on-google-cardboard/ Zenus VR is an outer space virtual reality first-person shooter, set out 2,000 years in the future! Zenus VR delivers a futuristic first person experience that has been optimized to deliver a competitive, immersive and seamless experience in Virtual Reality! STORY: You are the lone human survivor on the eerie planet of Zenus and the inhabitants don't take kindly to visitors! Your presence is not welcome and your only goal is to make it out alive!!!! Use your VR-headset as your Laser Ray Goggles to survive!!!!!  Known compatible VR Headsets: Google Cardboard, Boxzr VR, Merge VR, Homido VR, Zeiss VR One, Freefly VR, Durovis Dive, I Am Cardboard or any other Cardboard or iOS compatible VR Headset! Features: •	Virtual Reality Mode •      Choice of automatic shooting or headset trigger shooting •      Powerful laser weapon upgrades (The longer you survive, the more powerful your weapon becomes!) •	Special effects and animated sceneries •	Game Center integration •	Powerful Immersion •	Minimum iPhone requirement is iPhone 4s or later Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter @ZenusVR Please read Privacy Policy before playing
reviews: This was my very first VR experience and I haven’t played a video game in over 15 years! So I was a little reluctant at first. I had some questions initially and the developer was very quick to answer and assist. Once I got the hang of it, it was pretty easy to navigate and play. The concept is cool, it kept me on my feet and my head on a swivel, and the aliens were actually scary. I definitely screamed a couple of times. The game is a welcomed distraction. One of the best VR titles out right now. I’ve tried a few games similar to this but this one takes the cake. Kudos to the game developer for giving an option of automatic/manual firing as well. I’m a button pusher so I’m glad I have that option- Oh yeah, the aliens scared me as well( thats a good thing lol) I'm new to the the VR world...and Zenus with its bright and colorful graphics, intense music will captivate and entertain for hours. A multi-generational app that will delight adults and teens alike. I especially loved its user-friendly gaming features: the game is so versatile that a novice to VR will pick it up immediately and enjoy. Requires iOS 9.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone 5S, iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6S, iPhone 6S Plus, iPhone SE (1st generation), iPhone 7, iPhone 7 Plus, iPhone 8, iPhone 8 Plus, iPhone X, iPhone XS, iPhone XS Max, iPhone XR, iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro, iPhone 11 Pro Max, iPhone SE (2nd generation), iPhone 12 mini, iPhone 12, iPhone 12 Pro, iPhone 12 Pro Max, iPad Air, iPad Air Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad mini 2, iPad mini 2 Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Air 2, iPad Air 2 Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad mini 3, iPad mini 3 Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad mini 4, iPad mini 4 Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (12.9‑inch), iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) Wi-Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (9.7‑inch), iPad Pro (9.7‑inch) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad (5th generation), iPad (5th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) (2nd generation), iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) (2nd generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (10.5‑inch), iPad Pro (10.5‑inch) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad (6th generation), iPad (6th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (11‑inch), iPad Pro (11‑inch) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) (3rd generation), iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) (3rd generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad mini (5th generation), iPad mini (5th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Air (3rd generation), iPad Air (3rd generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad (7th generation), iPad (7th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (11‑inch) (2nd generation), iPad Pro (11‑inch) (2nd generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) (4th generation), iPad Pro (12.9‑inch) (4th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad Air (4th generation), iPad Air (4th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPad (8th generation), iPad (8th generation) Wi‑Fi + Cellular, iPod touch (6th generation), and iPod touch (7th generation).

name: ‎ACNH Connect
description: ACNH Connect is designed to make your Animal Crossing: New Horizons journey easier, more fun, and more social. Download the application to find other users' island, show off your own, connect with other players, and so much more! ACNH Connect is here to help you: Find the highest turnip prices and ask the owner of that island to visit Track down a specific special character Make new friends and share recipes Favorite islands with great design ideas Show off your new island design and host visitors *Please note that this application is specifically for Animal Crossing: New Horizons users. Players of other versions of the game will not find value in this application.
reviews: So far this is a nifty app and I honestly don’t know why Nintendo didn’t come out with something like this, its great and easy to use.Obviously its missing a few things as its new and still being developed over time (such as one of my villagers not being listed sweet Diane the Goat is not on my apps list of villagers).But I am excited for this app and will be using it hand in hand with my game; it beats finding everything separately and printing out sheets and sheets of paper. I mainly will be using this for fish bugs and fossils cause I can actually see what I am missing and not just the empty square on my in-game critterpedia and then having to run through my museums for the fossils.I do recommend any legit player get this app. Love this app great for making new friends and socializing within the AC community. The only issue I have with the app is the adds. I would love to see a paid version that gets rid of those. They become rather annoying. After every function an add plays. For instance I accept someone to visit my island an add plays. I message someone and go back to the him screen an add plays. Aside from that it’s an awesome app to have. Must have! Offer a paid version and I’d buy in a heartbeat. I’d probably rate it 4.5 just because there are a few bugs that can be kind of a pain & it could benefit from a few more capabilities (like posting pics instead of others just seeing your island). But otherwise this is a great app that’s full of great people & I highly recommend. I’ve had so much fun going to others islands & meeting people from around the world!
keywords: ACNH Connect, Francisco Pedro Contreras Nava, Social Networking, Role Playing, Games, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎A3: STILL ALIVE
description: Survive the darkness! ▣ Game Introduction ▶ A3: STILL ALIVE is a dark fantasy open-world RPG with a fully integrated battle royale mode on mobile.◀ ▣ Game Features A3: STILL ALIVE offers various competitive PvP battle modes that players can enjoy solo or with a group.   ▶ Dark Presence: Open-field 100 vs 100 large scale battle mode with unrestricted PK between two teams in the darkness! ◀ Fight to survive under the darkness of a  red moon. Beware! Your allies or guild members might suddenly become enemies! Try to survive the darkness with your team by defeating berserk players! ▶ Battle Royale: A survival game mode that ends with a sole victor. ◀ A real-time battle for survival where 30 players fight under the same conditions! Experience the tension that comes with fog of war as the battlefield shrinks with every passing moment.  Earn rare and exclusive loot by becoming the final survivor! ▶ Soul Linkers: The next generation of battle partners. ◀ No need to fight all alone!  Strategically select your Soul Linkers based on the situation to become the ruler of the battlefield! There are over 270+ different kinds of Soul Linkers sorted into 3 types: ATK, DEF, and SUPP. Become the ruler of the battlefield with the aide your Soul Linker's Ultimate powers! ▶ Guilds: Tackle various strategic battles with fellow guild members. ◀ [Conquest] Steal or be stolen from! Conquer more territory while battling the opposing guild! [Forte's Seal] Enjoy multiplayer mode with guild-exclusive raids! [Guild Festival] Participate in the festival in your guild hall with fellow guild members to acquire a number of Guild Chests that contain special items! ▶ Vast Open World! ◀ Explore rich environments such as snowfields, deserts, forests, and more!  ▶ 5 Different Classes With Unique Play Styles◀ [Templar] A magical melee character who uses a hammer to draw the holy power from within and a thick shield to withstand oncoming attacks. [Wizard] A magical ranged character who uses a spellbinding ring to unload powerful attacks.  [Berserker] A physical melee character who wields a great axe and a cursed power to pulverize the enemy.  [Archer] A physical ranged character who uses accurate shots and agile movements to toy with the enemy. [Assassin] A physical melee character who dives deep into enemy lines to unleash a sequence of attacks. ============================================================================ ■ Product Info and Use Conditions Info ■ ※ This app offers in-app purchases. You can disable this feature by adjusting your device’s settings. ※ By downloading this game, you are agreeing to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.    - Terms of Service: http://help.netmarble.com/policy/terms_of_service.asp?locale=en  - Privacy Policy: http://help.netmarble.com/policy/privacy_policy.asp?locale=en
reviews: So months ago I had my hopes up about this game and it definitely lived up to what it said it was going to be and I’m more than excited as a customer to be writing this the graphics are phenomenal the gameplay is phenomenal and it’s realistic the body movement is definitely realistic the storyline is absolutely fabulous it actually makes sense in the open world makes it just as more fun because you can actually talk to other people they have a microphone in the game so you can talk to people so it just makes the game ultimately all-around really great for a community building this is something I recommend for people who are here for the long term this game is gonna be great just came to be famous it’s definitely better than perfect world and all the others kills black desert Greetings!We are pleased to hear that you hold us in such high regard.Your genuine enthusiasm fills us with the determination needed to further improve the experiences of our players. We hope you look forward to what we have planned for the future!Thank you! I’ve been playing for 4 days straight without no break currently I’m lvl 72but i decide to delete the game. In doing so I have lose 4 days of precious time. This game can be addicting to the point where you don’t do your school work. At lvl 72 I faced a boss and decided to delete the game because I spent half a hours trying to defeat it after a couple tries I decide to quit the game for good and get off my life. What I’m trying to say is don’t spend your precious time before the games being played I suggest you don’t before you know it your grades are failing. Just watch XQC twitch streams ;) Greetings! We are sorry to hear about your experience with us so far. Your insights have made us more aware of the areas we can improve.  Please be patient as we work towards bettering our services.  Thank you! Game is great so far. Has exactly the same pros and cons as any of these other mmos mobile in store. My only gripe is the notification system. Red dot stays lit informing you that you can make a cash purchase and “save” some money. Really? Wasted time spent on feature that could be put to better use.Hence the 1 star. But solid mmo mobile game though. Like I said, it has the same shortcomings and advance features as the rest. Hundred souls does the same weapon system thing. Black Dessert does just about everything else this game does plus you can jump. And A4 does just about(minus the jump) the same but with mounts. Iunno maybe it’s just me, but any mmo where I can’t jump doesn’t feel realistic or “open world” to me. Honestly not sure what this game is really going for. But so far I like it. name: ‎After War - Idle Robot RPG
description: AFK RPG After War!  depart now to the world of After War!
reviews: Loving this game so far. I see a lot of potential. Graphics are great, and the sound effects are great too. Like the other guy who reviewed, I would also love to see online functionality at some point. Clans, pvp, world bosses, etc. Also, merging all your robots at once would be such a time saver. 3 at a time is super slow. An option to merge all of your robots (like “Merge All” option under each robot rarity section) would be incredible. Keep up the good work. I look forward to what will come to this game. On my first day with this app I made it to lvl 25 in a few hours, decided to leave the app open and take a nap to farm metal.After a 3 hour nap I was lvl 37 with 177,000 metal.   I spent the metal and upgraded my best robots gear to blue tier 3.    I then closed the app to respond to a friend, after a few minutes I opened the app back up and my progress was returned all the way back to lvl 25 before my nap.       Deleted the app because of this but am redone loading because it is great. I really hope stuff like this is worked on in the near future.

name: ‎Adventure Guild
description: THE SOCIAL MOBILE RPG YOU'VE BEEN WAITING FOR. Join the Adventure Guild and play the a tactical-turn-based-rogue-like-cooperative-dungeon-crawler-MMORPG that you can play on your phone or tablet wherever you want, whenever you want, and as much as you want. Create a party of Adventurers and team up with your friends to explore the deepest darkest dungeons in the world and bring home the loot. A FULL-FLEDGED RPG FOR MOBILE DEVICES: Gone are the expectations that mobile games lack depth and complexity. Adventure Guild strikes the perfect balance between the substantial gameplay of a real RPG and the simplicity of design mobile games demand. COMPLETELY CUSTOMIZE YOUR ADVENTURERS: Tweak everything visual from their facial features to their hair color to their wearable cosmetics without affecting equipment stats. Personalize their strategic playstyle by equipping new weapons and armor and choosing the loaded out Skills they take into battle. STRATEGIZE IN TACTICAL, TURN-BASED COMBAT: Use your Adventurers Skills to your advantage, and combo them with the rest of your party to outsmart the monsters in your path. Procedurally scaled and balanced combat encounters keep combat endlessly fresh and challenging. BRING HOME THE LOOT: Collect and equip thousands of combinations of procedurally generated weapons and armor, so you'll always have new gear to find. ADVENTURE ANYWHERE, ANYTIME: Adventure Guild is built for mobility from the ground up. Adventure with your friends on any device or OS. Our unbeatable cross-platform systems will make sure you never miss a beat. http://adventureguildgame.com

name: ‎Calvatole   カルヴァトーレ
description: パーティを編成してダンジョンを攻略する元祖ダンジョンRPG！  初心者に優しいオートマッピング機能(解除可)や、次の目的表示があって、お手軽にプレイできる！  謎を解き、ダンジョンに巣食う邪悪な魔物を排除し、難関ダンジョンを攻略せよ！ この世界にはソードマンやマジシャン、遊び人など様々な職業が存在する。また、7種の属性（火、水、風、土、光、闇、無）が存在し、キャラクターとモンスターの属性相性も重要になってくる。  純粋に強靭なパーティで挑むもよし、遊び人のみで挑むもよし、火属性キャラのみで挑むもよし、  ・・・様々な職業、属性をどう組み合わせるのかはあなたの自由！  好きなパーティを組んでダンジョンに挑戦しよう！ 戦闘はコマンド選択式ターン制バトル！  キャラクターとスキルの属性相性があり、倍になったり半減したりするため慎重にスキルを習得していこう。様々なスキルをどう使い分けるかはプレイヤーの腕にかかっているだろう。  また、モンスターはただ殴ってくるだけではなく様々な状態異常をばらまいてきたり、魔法が効かなかったり、一筋縄ではいかないだろう。しっかりした対策を心がけてほしい。 戦闘が終了すると経験値がもらえるだけではなく、モンスターが宝箱をドロップすることがある。レアアイテムを入手するチャンスだが、意気揚々と開けたりしたら大変なことに・・・気をつけよ！ 王は勇敢なる冒険者をいつでも心待ちにしている。  是非ともダンジョン攻略にチャレンジし、豪華な報酬を受け取ってくれ！  あなたの挑戦を待っている！！

Even a scrap of paper can be a hint. - Obtained items can be examined, dismantled, and compounded for new hints. - Think outside the box. Sometimes, it pays to follow your gut instinct. - Use common sense. - Stay alert and listen. Sometimes, sounds can help you successfully escape. Features: -Addicting mini puzzles! -Complete utilization of your iPhone and iPod features! -Gorgeous graphics and different themed floors! -Constant updates of New Floors! -Features mini escape games which are perfect to kill your free time -All stages selectable -Auto-save -Smartphone puzzles! -Addicting mini puzzles! -Gorgeous graphics and different themed rooms! -Constant updates of New Rooms! -It's FREE! Make sure to contact us if you have good ideas for new Floors! :) - How to Play - -Unlock the door to get to the next level. -To do that, pinch, poke, shake, tilt, swipe the on-screen images, to find a way to solve the puzzles. -You can pick certain items up and use them from your inventory. -For the first floor, tap the green elevator button to open the door. Tap the green arrow behind the door to go to the next floor. -For Floor 2, swipe the trashcan to move it aside and tap the green arrow button behind it. Tap the button in your inventory and tap the grayed out arrow above the red arrow. Tap the green button once it is placed to open the door. -Hint for Floor 4: What is the opposite motion of pinching? Enjoy the rest of the game! Features Unique brain teasers Challenging logic puzzles Easy to start – impossible to put down Auto-save function Amazing graphics Outside of the box thinking Balanced difficulty How to play Find and combine items Solve mini-puzzles just escape! Good luck and have fun!

name: ‎Dark Riddles
description: Become the best solver of the 70 most difficult dark riddles and solve all mysteries. Be the best detective in the group. Scary, tangled and surprising stories. Decide who will be the narrator. 2. The narrator reads the whole story - introduction and solution (the solution is hidden behind the question mark icon). 3. The narrator then reads aloud the introduction of the story to the others. 4. He asks them to guess what actually happened. 5. Guessers can only ask him questions that can be answered "YES/NO". Sometimes the guessers can turn away from the important parts of the story; in such cases, the narrator should help them get back to the point. Download the game and solve the best stories and puzzles! Find out what really happened.

reviews: This game is absolutely amazing. My favorite game franchise is Dark Souls and this game has a lot similarities (references) with it. For example the dark blood itself resembles dark sign from Dark souls, merchants are similar with undead merchants from Dark Souls 1, some monsters (like mimic) look similar etc. And one more thing that makes this game absolutely great is that it has some unique concepts like losing 1/2 of gold on “death” and instead of death there’s “exhaustion” actually and this is a card game after all, which makes it really cool. Also the game is very atmospheric, it has good soundtrack and surroundings. So after all, this game resembles Dark Souls in a lot of aspects and yet, it’s really new and unique. 5/5

reviews: “THIS GAME NEEDED TO CONNECT TO THE INTERNET SOMETIMES”I was playing happily offline after downloading the game but I figured that if I connect to a wifi while playing the game then more ads are gonna keep coming, so I turned it off and it was great. But when I leave the game and start it again... the loading part might take more than a half hour. So when I turn on the wifi... *POOF* ads came crashing in and it made me MAD. firstly, i get the devs have to make money and don't want to be greedy with micros (which i applaud them for) but when i literally can’t start the game without watching an ad, that seems a bit too much.Every time you complete a quest, ads, and half the time you’re playing there’s this annoying little bar ad across the top of the screen that can block some menus and won’t go away. However, i don’t want this to be an overly negative review as the rest of the game is awesome, straightforward with its fighting and absolutely beautiful art. All in all i give it a 3, ads are way too invasive and interrupt the gameplay. So, this game is actually really impressive tbh. The graphics are AMAZING (IPhone 8 plus) it’s console worthy tbh. And the characters and the skills/moves are engaging. A few things: it’s still super new, so I understand. But some dialogue issues in the game could be resolved, mostly misspelling. Also, the ads are quite distracting, but I can understand the reason for them. I just hope we can get an ad free version of the game soon. But great game!

name: ‎Dancing with the Stars : Game
description: You’ve seen the show, now live the life! Become a glamorous celebrity and begin your exciting journey on the world’s most popular dance competition in Dancing With The Stars, The Official Game!   Combining popular match-3 gameplay with innovative features, 'Dancing With The Stars: The Official Game' will give you the dancing experience you’ve been waiting for.   -          Addictive and sparkling Match-3 gameplay! -          Incredible and authentic dancing, just like on the show! -          Win beautiful prizes and build your wardrobe collection! -          Collect stunning and exotic dance dresses, and show off your unique fashion to your friends! -          Choose the path your celebrity will take with intriguing dilemmas! -          Compete in a weekly leaderboard, dancing your best moves in front of judges in the Live Show!   One of BBC Worldwide’s most popular global brands, Dancing with the Stars has been licensed to 52 countries, and a version of the show has been seen in over 75 countries, with over 250 series aired around the world to date - and now YOU can take part.   Follow us on social media: Twitter: @dwtsthegame Instagram: @dwtsthegame Facebook: visit our ‘Dancing With The Stars: The Official Game’ page This App contains: - links to selected social media sites - in-app purchases that cost real money - push notifications to let you know when we have exciting updates like new content - advertising   Privacy Policy: http://www.donutpublishing.com/index.php/privacy-policy/
reviews: Learning moves and choosing outfits. Gaining fans and vying for first place. It’s all the stuff we’ve dreamed of doing, wrapped around an absorbing match-three puzzler. If you love the show like we do, you’ll get swept up in the game like we did. I love the app, and it is so much fun but at times it gets boring. You train, get enough stars for dress rehearsal, do dress rehearsal, then you start all over. (Except for the occasional weekend performance). It’s the same thing over and over again. I have an idea to make it more interesting. You add a story line, apps like episode, choices, and my story are well loved because they are games with story lines. I bet if you add drama such as “Jenny sabotaged Sara’s performance” this app would do better. Add in characters that create a story and your character has the choice to communicate and chose options on what to say. Don’t get me wrong, the game is great, graphics and all....but I bet it will be fantastic if you added storylines. You already have fake characters in the app when you check what place you are in the competition, just give them lines and make it more interesting. Thanks~ I have played this game for years and reviewed it/updated my review as the game has progressed. The problems recently have become so bad that I reached out to support, who eventually emailed me to let me know they would be in touch. Progress because previously I had stopped contacting support through the game because they were never replying. I never heard back, however, and have been unable to open the game for over a week. This is a game I have played multiple times a day, competing in ongoing weeklong competitions. It’s something I actually care about. I have invested time and money into it, and cannot even get it to open. I tried to get it to open on a different device and it would only start a new game. I seemed to remember reading in the FAQs that you couldn’t transfer a game to a new device, so I went to check, but the FAQ only open an email to support. They are all gone. In the past I have had problems with this game making updates that were “flashy” for no reason and upsetting gameplay, but this is the first structural update that has made the game unplayable. I may sadly have to delete it from my phone. On the plus side, I’ll get so much space back it’s almost a blessing.
keywords: Dancing with the Stars : Game, Donut Publishing, Games, Puzzle, Role Playing, Entertainment, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

reviews: I have a few ideas to make the dark castle not as bland  1.Add new enemies to the dark castle my enemy ideas are the dark dragon the darker knight the dark witch and a mini boss for the dark castle 6-10 in story mode. Just so you know I have a idea for you if you think this will make the game too hard and its make every weapon and armor have upgrades the maximum amount of upgrades is 10 the tenth upgrade doubles the stats but you can’t upgrade the weapons or armor until you beat castle 5-1 mastery mode 2 and the weapons and armor isn’t upgraded with epic coins its going to be a new kind of coin called the legendary coin but also a new difficulty for avenger called mega mode. I wanted to tell you my favorite idea goodbye. The game is great, full of great responsive content with plenty of replay ability. The game teases you forward with all of its item RNG and hats tee progression. You can watch Ads when you get bonus chests for extra loot, which really helps (also gives your eyes a break and acts as a much needed pause button). The issue is that eventually for some reason, the game doesn’t register that you’re watching the ads, so you’ll get a really nice bonus chest and 7 ads later.. it’s still not collecting the chest. That’s very frustrating as you can imagine when the chest contains items you cannot obtain otherwise. The time taken to watch so many ads to progress on a phone game isn’t worth it overall when this starts happening. You don’t get your time back. Always remember that when dealing with a cash grab, to weigh time’s value to yourself. Whether it’s on purpose or not, it’s killing my interest and can’t help but feel I’m not the only one. I have 2 years experience with Dash Quest.-The game features a leveling system upon which you unlock new Weapons, Skills, Armor, Accessories, Spells, & Pets.- Huge variety of items from snowballs & mana potions to giant bombs & throwing knives.-The design of all that stuff is not complicated at all. It’s very streamlined, UNLIKE those hack/slash Taichi Panda or Zenonia type games with 50 menu/quest/inv. buttons everywhere.-There are about 100 monsters and 6ish bosses.-You can spend real world money but there is no need, even to excel.-The only con is the game can get repetitive. At first you get a littttle further each time, until you’re a higher level.BUT they offer a unique daily dungeon, which mixes things up and allows you to score legendary gear/upgrades.Verdict: If you like 8-Bit style graphics, and  RPG customization resemblant of Diablo, this game will not disappoint. If you absolutely despise runner games, look elsewhere.
keywords: Dash Quest, Tiny Titan Studios, Games, Adventure, Role Playing, Entertainment, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎Day R Survival
description: Can you survive in the world destroyed after a nuclear war? With radiation, hunger and diseases around you. You have to cross the whole country and save your family. Who knows if they are alive, or maybe radiation and deadly virus have already reached them? Reveal a secret of the apocalypse and get your memories back during a journey across the huge territory of the USSR in the 80th.  It is not easy to survive after apocalypse. You'll face the real hungry games! Monsters, zombie, thirst, uncountable diseases and injuries, blood-thirsty enemies – you have to fight it all. Craft all your resources: weapons, clothes, means of transport.  - Hardcore survival: Hunger, zombie and radiation won't give you a chance to relax. - Realistic world: The turn of the seasons, huge map of USSR and more than 2500 different towns and cities. Hunt animals, but be careful: even rats can injure you seriously! Explore the wilderness! - A lot of opportunities: Multicraft, obtaining skills, hundreds of crafting schemes, a lot of ammunition. - People and stories: Interesting quests and helpful allies. An open game world. - Improve your skills: Mechanics, medicine, chemistry and many others. - Cooperative mode: The Online mode  with a chat room, exchange of items and united fightings. Multiplayer survival game. Survive in post-nuclear USSR: defeat diseases, hunger and enemies! Play Online also! Survive with other players together. Explore the abandoned houses and shelters. Find weapon and build transport using various materials. Remember everything you learnt on chemistry and physics! It is the most realistic surviving game!  Features:  - Сraft system – get resources, hunt, find useful objects or weapon and create your own one!  - Hardcore simulator of survival  - Journey across the wilderness map in the multiplayer mode  - Choose the difficulty mode: sandbox, real life or online War never changes. In 1985 USSR went down before an unknown enemy. In a few days the entire country became a radioactive wasteland - violence, hunger and diseases reign here now. When you no longer loose in the fight with the death, the other survivors wait for you in the cooperative - the Online mode let you survive together dealing with difficulties, talking in the chat room and sending gifts to each other. User agreement: http://tltgames.ru/license-agreement-en
reviews: I’ve always enjoyed the game from when it was first released (but I would never call myself a veteran) and I’ve seen this game go through its ups and downs. But I’m making this for the people who think this is a “pay to win” or it’s “not a real survival game”. This game is a HARDCORE survival game and is meant to challenge your strategy skills and your survivability skills. It’s not meant for you to just go Into the first town and find a helicopter. This game has progression over hours of game play it’s meant to be long travels, cities and towns are meant to be a decent distance apart. And for the people who say this isn’t a real survival game. I wouldn’t be surprised if they were never in a real survival situation. And for the new comers of the game. This game is amazing I suggest it to everyone who loves the difficulty of survival and I challenge you not to rate it a 1-3 stars just after a day or so. Stay awhile and if you die just start over it’s not a huge deal. The game is meant to teach you about your mistakes so when you get back in a situation like that you know what to do. But I’ve said my peace and I’ve probably made some people mad but I will forever be apart of this community and even without Premium package I will still enjoy this amazing mobile game. 10/10. Update I just left my review of why the game has gone bad now and here is the review that of things I like in the new update and I think should be added number one I like the new nailed club they added in the game and that they move the Gillett suit because no one uses it mostly and I feel like they should add a machete into the game and more weapons number two I saw this in a different review and I agree that this game should have some kind of pump you can make like the water purifier and this pump will give you gas because gas is now hard to come by Number three I think that they should add wandering traders going around like a random event like you’ll be running on the road and all the sudden it will say event Number four I just want them to bring back the escape option in case you do not feel like battling Number five they should find a way to bring back tank armor mini gun and that one melee weapon that I don’t know what it’s name is because now they are unable to be obtained and a lot of people would love to have those Number six I feel like they should add new weapons and armor and other types of equipment that’ll help that is all and one more thing from my last post that I also want them to bring back is when you do quest or take down band bases you earn caps or you can watch ads to get caps that is all and I hope the people who make this game will see this. I'm going to be honest with you. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS GAME! It's so fun and I have been addicted to it for about a month. Love the feel of the game and it's hardcore game mechanics, but even with all that I was wondering if a few things could be added? Right now I'm I've built my base near the survivor camp closest to Ufa, and I've been farming to level up my skills. One problem I've stumbled upon a lot is... gas. Yes gas, one of the most common items in the game. Like right now I'm using a UAZ and I've tried to look for gas everywhere but I'm forced to leave it for a bike that I have just in case. So I feel like you be able to build like some type of pump that would get gas for you but you have to synthesize it with something else to actually get gasoline and it should require either blacksmithing, chemistry or survival or even learn how to build it from some quest. Same with machine oil juts have some pump synthesize it and BOOM machine oil and gasoline (or even diesel) for all your vehicle needs. Sorry this is super long but I felt I should address but otherwise love it and everyone who has made it this for I hope you have (or had) as much fun as I do!
keywords: Day R Survival, Aleksey Shurokhov, Games, Role Playing, Simulation, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

reviews: I REALLY love this game!! I wish you would have an update where you added more levels and bosses, because I was so sad to find out that there were only five "levels" (if you can call them that) there is some reply value if you want to see how fast you can beat the game (speed runners, I'm looking at you) but other than that not much. There was really nothing to use the light orbs we collected, (which btw, doesn't reset when you finish the game) like maybe introduce characters? And put more depth into the story... I really want to play more but there were areas that are just WAY too frustrating to come back to just because I want to play again :( I'm undecided between 4 or 5 stars... Really hope you guys listen and add some updates soon!!!! :D This game is incredible! Full of danger and thrills. And you really have to use your head, and be light on your feet. And the plot is genius. And the best part, you don’t need WiFi in order to play it. I HIGHLY recommend playing this game. If you are looking for a game with adventure, mystery, thrills, danger, a great plot, and where you need to be able to figure things out, GET THIS GAME! 👍👍👍👍👍 I like the game. I really do. But there are so many adds. The game asked me to write a review and an add popped up before I could click to rate it. Every time you die there’s another add. I get it. It’s a free game so adds are the only way to pull in revenue, but does there have to be so many? The controls aren’t that awkward, so I would rate it higher if there were less adds. Oh wait never mind. When I returned to the app it asked me to pay to remove adds. So this is one of those games that pesters you until you pay to remove adds? Okay then.

name: ‎Darkzone - Idle RPG
description: Your adventure as an intergalactic bounty hunter is about to begin... In the Darkstar Galaxy, the Darkzone is a lawless district where, for millennia, the most vicious crime factions have prospered. Too dangerous for Federation police to surveil, the Darkzone is widely known to be a hive for much of the illegal activity that plagues the rest of the galaxy. To the four largest crime factions in the galaxy, and thousands of bounty hunters, raiders, smugglers, mercenaries, and other criminals, the Darkzone is home... Join Ka’ Nuun and his newly formed crime faction, NEMESIS, in an epic quest for vengeance! War is imminent and your hitlist is fast-growing. Crush them all while you build up your fame, wealth, loot, and stash, in your ambitions to becoming the most prolific bounty hunter in the galaxy! MAIN FEATURES • Online Idle RPG • Auto battle hack n' slash play • Clicker (tapper) or Idle character builds • Incremental progression • Real-time multiplayer • Live and idle co-op • Exciting loot • Guilds and Seasons • P2P Trading • Deep itemization/builds • Story and campaign • AFK Progress • Skins and cosmetics • No energy system • Absolutely no ads STORY-DRIVEN PROGRESS An epic adventure with constant progression and bounties, quests, and areas to explore, all while still having a central storyline and cutscenes which expand on the Darkzone’s story. LIVE AND IDLE CO-OP Form alliances with other bounty hunters and invite them to join you in real-time, or asynchronous (afk), multiplayer co-op battles. EXCITING LOOT SYSTEM Build your bounty hunters with awesome gear via a loot system heavily inspired by hack n’ slash PC classics like Diablo, Torchlight, and Path of Exile. You can’t buy Chests or Gear, and forget about an energy system. Darkzone is all about slaying monsters, farming loot, and improving your gear to design that stat-perfect build. DEEP ITEMIZATION/BUILDS Fill your inventory and stash with Common, Rare, Epic, and LEGENDARY biomech implants with sockets, mods, and sets to be built. Every build in the game is unique with thousands of potential combinations for active, clicker, or auto-battle styles of play. FAST-PACED AUTO BATTLES Teleport in and out of hack n’ slash combat with ease and run a quick raid or mission in a battle system designed for mobile. Emerge from the shadow and show what true bounty hunting legends are made of. CUSTOMIZABLE PLAY STYLES Build your bounty hunters to your exact liking. You can tank, go DPS, or go for a bruiser build. You can go all auto, semi-auto, or go for a clicker (tap) style of play...all depending on your gear and how you divide your attribute points. AFK & IDLE PROGRESS Hire raiders and smugglers to work for you and earn loot while you are AFK. They’ll have materials, gear and resources waiting for you when you get back. P2P TRADING Use the live chat to find other bounty hunters looking to trade in real-time or asynchronously. Send and receive offers, and counter them when you don’t think the deal is quite right. CUSTOMIZE YOUR LOOK Earn and purchase outfits, weapon skins, and avatars for your bounty hunters, and don't miss out on limited edition event cosmetics. BEAUTIFUL 2D ART STYLE Darkzone is hand-drawn from the ground up. Beautiful 2D models and bone-based animations with a unique art style that combines comic, cartoon, and realism. There's enough games that have the exact same art style. We wanted to at least break the mold. CONSTANT CONTENT UPDATES An active, indie, development team with unique ideas coming hot through the pipeline. Much, much more coming soon in future updates. NOTE: Darkzone is brought to you by an indie team. The game is still in early access, but we’re working around the clock. If you find a bug, or issue, report it and we’ll sort it out immediately.  Join our online communities of bounty hunters! DISCORD https://discord.gg/SxxxNc9 REDDIT https://www.reddit.com/r/DarkzoneGame/ TWITTER https://www.twitter.com/twdarkzone
reviews: This game strikes a great balance as a semi-idle game. If you’re feeling like you need something more engaging than the typical clicker/tap progression game, inspired a bit more by RPGs, then give this a shot!The battles can be done auto OR active. You can partner with a friend live, or in an offline/auto scenario. There are multiple viable builds for each playable hunter, and the gear hunt for optimal stats and mods is quite extensive and satisfying.As far as I know, the lag issues you’ll read about in other reviews are resolved. The game is still in beta and quickly evolving, but I’ve not run into any bug that I would consider gamebreaking.Lastly, the community and developers are quite active on discord, so any questions, needs, or suggestions are quickly heard and addressed. The gameplay and the ideas are great. I still play the game. However there are numerous bugs and glitches in the game which make it frustrating to play. If you like beta testing this game is for you! The devs are active and play the game. They are still developing for the game. Easy to talk to on their discord server. This is not a game you can respond to txts or even look at notifications. It doesn’t have great idle play. It is a grind for gold and gear. If you enjoy a slow grind that requires your constant presence this game is for you. The server disconnects and lag spikes will require you to stay at your phone to continue playing! Game is a really fresh experience for any long time mobile gamer. The community is also amazing and has some of the most caring and interactive devs I have ever seen via their discord server that you can find on the game. Can’t wait to see where this indie team takes this game and how it evolves. Excited to know you are enjoying the Darkzone, bounty hunter! Looking forward to seeing you around as we continue to grow the game quickly. Join us on Discord via our website to keep up with our latest updates. If you have any suggestions or questions, please feel free to reach out. Thanks!
keywords: Darkzone - Idle RPG, Capitanos, Games, Strategy, Role Playing, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

name: ‎Earplay
description: With Earplay, you can play audio stories with your voice, featuring high quality voice acting, music, and sound effects like in a radio drama. Experience this exciting new storytelling medium where you become part of the story, interacting with characters to affect how the events unfold. EARPLAY The Earplay Demo in the Earplay hub is an introductory demonstration of our unique style of interactive audio storytelling. It is written and hosted by the legendary Dave Grossman, Earplay's creative lead, and one of the most prominent interactive story writers in the games industry. To learn more about Dave and Earplay, visit https://www.earplay.com PUGMIRE (By Pugsteady and Onyx Path) Dogs have inherited the world, building the kingdom of Pugmire untold centuries after the Ages of Man are over. Pugmire is a world that juxtaposes the tropes of high fantasy with our relationship with domestic dogs. The main characters are pioneers that explore lost ruins in search of relics, knowledge, and danger. The world is dangerous and mysterious, but good dogs will persevere. THEY CAME IN OUTER SPACE (By Double RR Studios) In this comedy that plays off of 50's style sci-fi B-movie and radio drama tropes, Herbie Zoozman Jr., has reinvented the Interactive Cranial Activit-O-Vision ™, where YOU are Zoozman’s Co-Producer in charge of  the mythic story of rocket-jockey Commander Brad L. Whiteman and his journey to a planet inhabited entirely by "Panther Women." HEAD GAMES (Enhanced with Bose AR) This Sci-Fi thriller is controlled by gestures like nodding, head shaking, ducking, and turning, as well as voice. When you are contacted by mental telepathy while using the Bose device, an NSA agent guides you to communicate with head gestures to prevent an alien invasion. But the aliens want to tell you their side of the story. Who will you trust? Developed in partnership with Bose, this story experience is enhanced by Bose AR, a first-of-its-kind audio augmented reality platform. CODENAME CYGNUS Enjoy mission one of the first ever voice-operated interactive audio story, a spy thriller where you play the secret agent. Originally launched in August 2013, six episodes of the story (and a bonus holiday episode) have been released so far. Learn more at http://codenamecygnus.com and https://www.earplay.com OFFICE HOURS Dial in to office hours of the dubious Professor Fenster, esteemed interactive storytelling professor of Story University. Is his latest story bot research ethical, or is he hiding something? This Earplay story was created for the 2017 Future of Storytelling Festival. To learn more visit https://futureofstorytelling.org/ NOTE TO PARENTS Not all stories in the Earplay application will be suitable for all ages. Please use your own discretion, as parental review and guidance regarding Earplay content may be necessary. All content that contains material of a restricted nature will be accessible only with a registered Earplay account. SUPPORT Email us at support@earplay.com if you have any difficulties or to let us know what you'd like to hear next.
reviews: Interesting, and initially strange to be faced with choices that include "kiss the strange young woman who just sat down across the table from you in the restaurant, and is hurriedly demanding you kiss her". I'm sure I'm not the only person for whom kissing a female would not be the first choice of whom to kiss. But I decided, go with it woman! I will assume that the story writers will permit us to select in our own minds, in each game scenario, whether the character we are playing is heterosexual, bi or homosexual,… And male, female or gender neutral? (Or any other options that may exist but I am currently spacing on, LOL?) Cannot wait to find out whether they will let us select a different ethnic/cultural background within a game story,… or different skill sets say for an agent? Will they eventually expand the interaction to, say, let us ask our "handler" (a.k.a. the voice in our heads) to "remind us who someone is", or "describe the room/building/location" we are in? If these interactive audio games come even halfway to matching my imagination, this should be a blast while I'm getting other real life but boring things accomplished. This game looks to be lots of fun, however, there are accessibility issues that need to be resolved causing me to give this only a four star review rather than the five star it could have. Outside of that, game content and quality is great, and refreshing to find something different.
keywords: Earplay, Earplay, Inc., Games, Adventure, Entertainment, Role Playing, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes

reviews: I really wanna like this game because the graphics are actually pretty good, and I enjoy simple one-touch games. But there are just way too many ads to spend any consistent time playing it. A different ad plays after every round lost, which really turns me off. Also, the controls could be much improved. Please add a replay button, too! At least there are a wide number of emojis to use. If you make these simple adjustments, I'd be willing to try the game again! My ten year old said this game stinks literally and figuratively. The lag time between when you press the jump button and when the jump actually happens is so long that the game is virtually unplayable. Couple that with levels that rarely change and you have an idea that could have been great but is so poorly executed. Wasted .99 cents!

name: ‎Elemental Saga: The Awakening
description: Become an Elemental and harness your powers over Water, Earth, Electricity, or the Enchanting Light itself! Can you save the world and still make it in time for classes!? "Elemental Saga: The Awakening" is a 100,000-word interactive fantasy novel by Mandar Deshmukh, where your choices control the story. It's entirely text-based--without graphics or sound effects--and fueled by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination. • Master any one of four different elements. • Build your character, your relationships and guide them in the coming war. • Choose your stance - Fight or Retreat. • Rise up as a revered icon or lay down as a scapegoat.
reviews: I felt it was over all an amazing story that even though I feel like there is not many player decisions and there are quite a few grammatical errors, but I over all was quite impressed with the story after my first play through and can't wait for the 2nd part! There might be quite a few spelling and grammatical errors but I don't feel it took that much out of the game or made it unplayable so keep that in mind. Water. Earth. Fire. Air. Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony. Then, everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them, but when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years passed and my brother and I discovered the new Avatar, an airbender named Aang. And although his airbending skills are great, he has a lot to learn before he's ready to save anyone. But I believe Aang can save the world I greatly enjoyed the story. I wish there were more choices in the story...maybe add in a feature where you can go back and change a decision without having to restart the whole story and also show a few pictures of the characters and their powers. Please hurry with the next part....that cliffhanger at the end had me replaying the story multiple times.

name: ‎Farm Animal Idle Life Sim Game
description: Farm animal idle life sim game is super funny and happy sims game that will save you from boredom. Meet jack, your donkey friend. He has no friends because no one likes him. He left the jungle because he was considered useless. He always wanted to be the king of the jungle but he could never be one in the presence of a lion. Jack is now living in a small town. This is the game of life for jack. Help your donkey friend to become the king of the village animals by winning levels and getting rewards. He loves living in the village and this makes him happy.  The game of games is the donkey race. All the donkeys from the village gather around in the animal crossing to watch the race and motivate their friends. The real hero is the one who wins this race. Prepare him for the run. Help Jack wins the race so he can impress jenny, love of his life. Racing in the race would make him an idol. Another challenge is to collect the gems. The more the gems the more points you will get. There will be small fields for jack to play in. Playing will boost his health. Take him to the field, meet his friends and let them play.  Farm animal idle life sim game have real village adventures and routine chores. It is a wildlife game. The real simulator effects and sims visual make it more interesting. Moreover, the game is a family game and kids love it already. The village graphics in the game will give you the lifelike experience. Vfx sounds like running, walking and kicking makes the game more fun. name: ‎Fallen Hero: Rebirth
description: Become the greatest telepathic villain Los Diablos has ever known! Once you were famous; soon you will be infamous. That is, unless your old friends in the Rangers stop you first. Juggle different identities and preserve your secrets as you build new alliances and try to forget the friendships you've left behind. "Fallen Hero: Rebirth" is a 380,000 word interactive novel by Malin Rydén, where your choices control the story. It's entirely text-based—without graphics or sound effects—and fueled by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination. • Hone your telepathic talents, possess people and venture into their minds. • Build your own personalized combat armor: be a terrifying super-strong behemoth, a mysterious speedster or anything inbetween. • Make alliances or enemies in the Los Diablos underworld while you outfight and outthink the heroes set against you. • Explore relationships as straight, gay, bisexual or aromantic. Romance a mad scientist, your former partner, or both. • Juggle two bodies and three identities, play as male, female or genderqueer. • Above all; make sure your past never catches up with you. How far will you fall down the path of villainy?
reviews: I must say that as of fan of the products you’ve produced this one might well be my all time favorite. I greatly enjoyed the mechanic of having control of two characters and potentially having two different personalities between the two. Plus I feel this game gives me an experience that isn’t all that touched on too well. The ability to be the villain! I’ve played the academy for upcoming super villains and I enjoyed it my first time through. But ultimately it felt lacking in motivation. I entered the school because my mother was a villain? Here my character suffered a traumatic experience that caused serious mental and physical injuries. Also your choice of what villain you will be is a fine touch as well. And with how the ending appeared for me, I’m looking forward to a potential sequel. I can’t remember a time I read a story this quickly. It’s such an interesting world they’ve created and the characters are all so interesting. In the beginning it felt a little more like you could steer the story yourself but as things progressed I felt more like the character’s bitterness kind of overwhelmed your ability to choose. So my choices looked out of place with the story. Maybe that’s because of the answers I chose earlier on, I don’t know, but playing a full on villain while not getting the full picture about what happened to make your character want to destroy their former friends/allies broke some of my immersion. If I’m gonna be that vengeful to some seemingly decent folks, I kind of want more of a complete picture. Maybe I’d have learned more about the incident from their past with different choices. Also RO wise, for a player choosing to date guys but not wanting to have a romantic relationship with Ortega, the interactions got a little frustrating.  Kind of felt like he was the only real option and he was constantly thrown at you. Regardless of the things I didn’t love, I really adore Fallen Hero and will replay it. Also excited for the next book!! The good: You’re playing a character who is struggling emotionally.  I would say that she had a mild personality disorder (inability to trust other people) which was exacerbated by PTSD.  Your choices and the writing manage to force you to stay within the constraints of your mental illness, while still allowing you some leeway about how to react in particular situations.  Because of the skillful writing, you can feel some of her emotions, like you would in a good novel.  More generally, the author really does know how to write well.  Setting the scene and dialogue/banter are novel-quality, which is not the case in many CoG/Hosted Games.The bad: A lot of information crucial to your character is revealed piecemeal throughout the story.  I think some of it still hasn’t been revealed.  This includes her history (events that made her the way she is), her goals, and the practical plans to accomplish them.  Since your character would know all of these things, it left me feeling unable to fully absorb myself in her.  I could feel her emotions like she was a whole person, but when I tried to think like her, she was a cardboard cutout.
keywords: Fallen Hero: Rebirth, Hosted Games LLC, Games, Books, Role Playing, Adventure, ios apps, app, appstore, app store, iphone, ipad, ipod touch, itouch, itunes
